page.title: 10 MORPETH MARKET
page.content: In{1199,}a{Royal Charter}was granted to{Robert de Merley}which authorised a Market to be held.It was situated in the{Market Place}until{1903}when a site later known as the{Newmarket,} was created.Traders and Cattle dealers amalgamated in{1938}and traded until{ {1957}when the{Cattle Market}was transferred to{Stobhill.} {Morpeth Market,19th May,1985:}30 shoppers_{3O%}of people came from Morpeth and one person from Edinburgh. {33%}visit monthly.{27%}attend weekly. 30% spend thirty minutes there.Only one customer spends more than three hours.{67%}browse before buying.{70% think thatyou get value for money.{37% prefer shops.{20%}prefer the market. {66%}of stallholders live within 15 miles of Morpeth.{Morning}was most popular for shopping.
